item.title: Controversial chatbot's safety measures 'a sticking plaster'
item.description: Character.ai is facing legal action in the US over claims a bot on the site encouraged a teenager to kill his parents.

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg's Meta donates $1m to Trump fund
item.description: It appears to be the latest attempt by the Meta boss to build a closer relationship with the incoming president.

item.title: INFAMOUS: The Preppy Murder in New York
item.description:
This episode was originally released in October 2019, and is one of sixteen episodes from the archives we'll be bringing you every Thursday, now through end of year... for good reason! ;) We highly recommend you listen to each episode between now and end of 2024, and follow us on Instagram @crimejunkiepodcast so you're the first to know what's coming next! <3

When Jennifer Levin is found murdered in Central Park in 1986, one of her private school friends is arrested for the crime. This catalyzes bitter debates about sex, privilege, legal ethics, parental responsibility, socioeconomics, victim's rights, and so much more. Before there was the OJ Simpson trial, there was the Preppy Murder.

Source materials for this episode cannot be listed here due to character limitations. For a full list of sources, please visit: crimejunkiepodcast.com/infamous-preppy-murder/

item.title: Australia to force tech giants to keep paying for news
item.description: The long-awaited decision follows a standoff with Meta, and succeeds a world-first law from 2021.

item.title: WhatsApp and Instagram restored after Meta outages
item.description: Over 22,000 people reported issues with Facebook on Wednesday evening and over 18,000 struggled to use WhatsApp, according to Downdetector.

item.title: Hackers find hole in Krispy Kreme Doughnuts' cyber-security
item.description: The hack has left some hungry customers unable to make online orders.

item.title: Chatbot 'encouraged teen to kill parents over screen time limit'
item.description: Legal action filed in Texas alleges Character.ai 'poses a clear and present danger' to young people.

item.title: General Motors pulls plug on robotaxi business
item.description: After the announcement, the project's co-founder posted on social media "GM are a bunch of dummies."

item.title: Tech Life: Cyber warfare
item.description: Cyber warfare, aerodynamic tech in athletics and the new Indiana Jones.

item.title: Amazon and eBay to pay 'fair share' for e-waste recycling
item.description: Firms which produce e-cigarettes will also be asked to pay more towards UK recycling.

item.title: What is rage-baiting and why is it profitable?
item.description: Called rage-baiting, making people angry with social media posts can be a business.

item.title: Nvidia targeted by China in new chip war probe
item.description: The investigation follows a US decision to further restrict sales to chip equipment makers in China.

item.title: TikTok asks for emergency pause to looming US ban
item.description: The app says the Supreme Court - and incoming Trump administration - needs more time to consider the case.

item.title: Google unveils 'mind-boggling' quantum computing chip
item.description: It solves in five minutes a problem computers now would need 10,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000 years to work out, Google says.

item.title: INFAMOUS: The Lake Waco Murders Part 2
item.description:
A community demands answers when three teenagers are found brutally slain in a scenic lakeside park, and it breathes a collective sigh of relief as righteous local lawmen quickly zero in on the perpetrators. But when the dust finally settles, many are forced to ask: who pays the price when ego eclipses justice?

This is Part 2 of 2. Make sure to listen to INFAMOUS: The Lake Waco Murders Part 1 before diving into this one… you’re going to want to know the first part of this wild and twisty case.

And for more information on the 2025 Crime Junkie Tour, please visit our website!

Source materials for this episode cannot be listed here due to character limitations. For a full list of sources, please visit: crimejunkiepodcast.com/infamous-lake-waco-part-2

item.title: TikTok set to be banned in the US after losing appeal
item.description: The app - which faces being banned in a matter of weeks - says it will now take its case to the Supreme Court.

item.title: Online star Hawk Tuah girl faces crypto coin criticism
item.description: Haliey Welch's "Hawk" digital coin shot up in price then lost 95% of its value just hours after it launched.

item.title: Is AI any good at choosing gifts?
item.description: With vast amounts of data do draw on, AI should be able to come up with good gift ideas, but does it?

item.title: What next for Bitcoin after bursting $100k barrier?
item.description: The rapid increase in price has been attributed to Donald Trump's election victory - can it continue?

item.title: Vodafone boss says prices won't rise after Three 'mega-merger'
item.description: The deal, which creates the UK's biggest mobile network, has had to overcome competition concerns.
